slides.title: Understanding ROI
slides.content:
# ROI Analysis ğŸ’°

Measuring the return on investments.

## What is ROI?

Return on Investment - a ratio that compares net profit to investment cost.

## Basic Formula

**ROI = (Gain - Cost) / Cost Ã— 100%**

## Example

Investment: $10,000
Return: $15,000

ROI = ($15,000 - $10,000) / $10,000 Ã— 100
ROI = 50%

## Why ROI Matters

- Compare investment options
- Justify spending
- Measure project success
- Prioritize resources

> ğŸ’¡ ROI is the universal language of business!

slides.title: Types of ROI
slides.content:
# Types of ROI Analysis ğŸ“Š

## Simple ROI
- Basic gain vs cost
- Quick calculation
- Ignores time value

## Annualized ROI
- Accounts for holding period
- Better for comparisons

**Annualized ROI = [(1 + ROI)^(1/n)] - 1**

## Payback Period
- Time to recover investment
- Simple but ignores profit after

**Payback = Investment / Annual Cash Flow**

## NPV (Net Present Value)
- Time value of money
- More sophisticated

## IRR (Internal Rate of Return)
- Return as percentage
- Used for capital budgeting

> ğŸ¯ Use appropriate method for context!

slides.title: Cost-Benefit Analysis
slides.content:
# Cost-Benefit Analysis ğŸ“‹

A structured approach to evaluating projects.

## Steps

### 1. Identify Costs
- Direct costs (purchase, labor)
- Indirect costs (training, maintenance)
- Opportunity costs

### 2. Identify Benefits
- Revenue increases
- Cost reductions
- Productivity gains
- Risk reduction

### 3. Quantify
- Assign dollar values
- Use estimates for intangibles

### 4. Compare
- Calculate net benefit
- Consider risk

## Decision Rule

- Benefits > Costs â†’ Proceed
- Benefits < Costs â†’ Reconsider

> ğŸ’¡ Include both tangible and intangible factors!

slides.title: Marketing ROI
slides.content:
# Marketing ROI ğŸ“ˆ

Measuring marketing effectiveness.

## Formula

**Marketing ROI = (Revenue from Marketing - Marketing Cost) / Marketing Cost Ã— 100**

## Key Metrics

| Metric | Formula |
|--------|--------|
| ROAS | Revenue / Ad Spend |
| CPA | Ad Spend / Acquisitions |
| CLV:CAC | Lifetime Value / Acquisition Cost |

## Challenges

- Attribution complexity
- Long sales cycles
- Brand value measurement

## Best Practices

- Track incrementality
- Use control groups
- Consider full funnel
- Account for time lag

slides.title: Technology ROI
slides.content:
# Technology ROI ğŸ’»

Justifying technology investments.

## Common Benefits

- Productivity improvements
- Error reduction
- Time savings
- Scalability

## Common Costs

- License/purchase
- Implementation
- Training
- Maintenance
- Opportunity cost

## TCO (Total Cost of Ownership)

All costs over useful life:
- Initial purchase
- Installation
- Training
- Support
- Upgrades
- Retirement

## Red Flags

- âŒ Over-optimistic benefits
